result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas William Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas William Perry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Greenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney. Does not qualify for SPD.
Defendant enters plea of guilty. 
Court finds defendant has knowingly waived his right to an attorney for today's proceedings. 
Present bond continued
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lucas William Perry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan M Spaude in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State Public Defender's Office has not appointed attorney for defendant. 
Present bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas William Perry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Eric R. Enli in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
